creator: ronald@ortv.com
text:
I am hunting a problem more than one month, ... I hope I can get a hint from the
developers, since forum and mailing lists did not had any clue.

The system:
PC with SuSE Linux 8.0 and kernel 2.4.20
Apache 2.0.45
PHP-3.2RC1
MySQL 4.0.12

The software: PHPnuke 6.5
The server works correct, when data are updated on the same LAN.
After testing we moved the server to the server co-location place and now we
cannot add LONG stories, cannot change preferences (of PHPnuke).
Since nothing has been changed - except the IP address it is very hard to narrow
down. I believe that we get a timeout when we try to change / add data, but I
cannot find any variable what I could set to overcome this.
As shorter the new article as more sure it will be taken, if the article gets
longer, it might be that we need just to submit the article several times, and
it will be taken.

I think the flow of the data is: editor site --> apache 2.0 --> php --> mysql 
If the data are not taken, than the next home page will be displayed without any
delay, which makes me think that the (possible) timeout is in apache.

Till last week I was the only one with that problem, but today I found in
nuke4newbie, nukeforum also other people experiencing the same problem.

Any hints are highly appreciated!

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Sorry, but there isn't much we can do without details on exactly what is
failing.  (And you probably moved on from this problem ages ago.)

Thanks for using Apache!
